results.title: Stop that Fire
results.brief_description: A safety education film, warning against the hazards of fire, aimed at people who work in factories, shops, offices and warehouses.

results.title: Still Life
results.brief_description: This film starts out appearing to be an art documentary about a Scottish painter Lawrence Angus Mc Coney. It uses artwork, animation and photographic effects to give a vivid sense of the artist’s life. ‘Still Life’ is a humorous send up of art criticism but it also sets out to express what it feels like to be an artist. Narrated by Gary Bond.

results.title: Sticky fingers
results.creator_credit: Joannna N Rosner and Aptos Film Productions
results.brief_description: A training film for shopowners and law enforcement officers showing typical shoplifting methods and explaining how to deter and detect them. Starring Mike Connors.

results.title: Step right up!
results.creator_credit: Mike Lloyd Ross, Ray Jewell and Film Communications
results.brief_description: Illustrates the possible hazards and improper procedures when using ladders. Shows the proper use of stepladders, straight ladders, and extension ladders. Also focuses on inspection, maintenance, carrying, ladder stances, erecting and securing, climbing and descending. Camera: Peter Good.

results.title: Stencil art
results.brief_description: This DV Public Imaging work explores the graphic street art of stencil painting. This predominantly political form of street communication and resistance has risen in visibility in recent years. Using the streets of Melbourne as the visual basis for this work, the viewer will be afforded the vision of the different visual and textual styles, edited into a work that is, at times, abstract and, at others, forcefully potent in its political delivery.

results.title: Know your car
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Jam Handy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
An instructional training film for students or drivers, presenting a simple exposiiton of the physical principles and mechanics of a car - suspension, steering, fuel combustion, clutch, gears, brakes etc.

results.title: Introduction to preventive maintenance
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
Shows the importance of preventive maintenance in truck operation and illustrates a typical preventive maintenance check as applied to the clutch pedal, the battery and the voltage regulator.

results.title: Clutch and handbrake
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to determine and correct the amount of clutch pedal clearance or “lash”, check clutch for slipping, grabbing or drag; how to inspect and adjust the hand brake.

results.title: Steering, wheels, front and rear axles
results.creator_credit: United States. Army. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to check for play in the steering wheel and the front end assembly; correct wheel run-out; make a test; test springs, axles and overall back-lash.

results.title: Periodic check-up
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
The necessary steps in the periodic check-up of a car. Including the brake system, inspecting the steering systems and inspecting chasses and body.
